commits.message:
Planning for better @dark,@light modifiers

Should be possible to override the default browser `prefers-color-scheme` for @light and @dark modifiers, as well as marking certain subregions like a menu or modal as light, while the rest of the app is dark. Will be added in beta.

fdir++, npm i ignore, imba fmt respect gitignore, submodules, and hidden
dirs
Don't go to the same url multiple times

issue.title: Passing objects without {} sometimes ambiguous
issue.body:
### Description

Works as intended:
```
cb! if await model.update { bool: yes }
```

Does not work as intended:
```
cb! if await model.update
	bool: yes
```


### Reproduction

_No response_

### System Environment

_No response_

comment.body: Didn't notice the `cb()` method - in that case I have no idea how to interpret it.

issue.title: Passing objects without {} sometimes ambiguous
issue.body:
### Description

Works as intended:
```
cb! if await model.update { bool: yes }
```

Does not work as intended:
```
cb! if await model.update
	bool: yes
```


### Reproduction

_No response_

### System Environment

_No response_

comment.body:
The second one looks like a hash in an if statement - so what should compiler throw in this situation?
In some languages if you wanted to stick to the previous line you would use `\` before new line - and this way it would be interpreted as you intended.

comment.body: Yeah, I've also faced this quite a bit recently. The app isn't working, and I receive no error. I usually work around it by manually compiling `imbac suspect.imba` which is obviously not a good experience. Sometimes it takes time to know what's going on!

commits.message: Add shorthand for referencing top literal tag in nested styles
Include self as argument in mount/unmount events
Include a reference to the original node for placeholders

Add Event.original getter

For any custom event emitted via a listener (@click.emit('something')) it returns the original event. For original events it returns the event itself.

issue.title: Shadow part selector not supported
issue.body: Imba supports pseudo element selectors `css li::marker c:blue4` but not shadow part selectors `css li::part(part3) bg:black` [Reproduction link](https://stackblitz.com/edit/vitejs-vite-5yqebp?file=main.imba) Here is the error the compiler outputs when not minified ``` [ImbaTraverseError: Rule expected but "(" found.] { error: Error: Rule expected but "(" found. at ParseContext.parse (file:///Users/abdellah/workspace/scrimba/imba/packages/imba/dist/compiler.mjs:12507:13) at CssSelectorParser.parse (file:///Users/abdellah/workspace/scrimba/imba/packages/imba/dist/compiler.mjs:12934:22) at parse (file:///Users/abdellah/workspace/scrimba/imba/packages/imba/dist/compiler.mjs:13141:21) at parse2 (file:///Users/abdellah/workspace/scrimba/imba/packages/imba/dist/compiler.mjs:13515:13) at StyleRule.toString (file:///Users/abdellah/workspace/scrimba/imba/packages/imba/dist/compiler.mjs:15894:55) at StyleRuleSet.visit (file:///Users/abdellah/workspace/scrimba/imba/packages/imba/dist/compiler.mjs:28923:73) at Node2.traverse (file:///Users/abdellah/workspace/scrimba/imba/packages/imba/dist/compiler.mjs:17255:12) at ListNode.visit (file:///Users/abdellah/workspace/scrimba/imba/packages/imba/dist/compiler.mjs:17938:26) at Node2.traverse (file:///Users/abdellah/workspace/scrimba/imba/packages/imba/dist/compiler.mjs:17255:12) at TagLike.visit (file:///Users/abdellah/workspace/scrimba/imba/packages/imba/dist/compiler.mjs:26652:21), ```

issue.title: Shadow part selector not supported
issue.body: Imba supports pseudo element selectors `css li::marker c:blue4` but not shadow part selectors `css li::part(part3) bg:black` [Reproduction link](https://stackblitz.com/edit/vitejs-vite-5yqebp?file=main.imba) Here is the error the compiler outputs when not minified ``` [ImbaTraverseError: Rule expected but "(" found.] { error: Error: Rule expected but "(" found. at ParseContext.parse (file:///Users/abdellah/workspace/scrimba/imba/packages/imba/dist/compiler.mjs:12507:13) at CssSelectorParser.parse (file:///Users/abdellah/workspace/scrimba/imba/packages/imba/dist/compiler.mjs:12934:22) at parse (file:///Users/abdellah/workspace/scrimba/imba/packages/imba/dist/compiler.mjs:13141:21) at parse2 (file:///Users/abdellah/workspace/scrimba/imba/packages/imba/dist/compiler.mjs:13515:13) at StyleRule.toString (file:///Users/abdellah/workspace/scrimba/imba/packages/imba/dist/compiler.mjs:15894:55) at StyleRuleSet.visit (file:///Users/abdellah/workspace/scrimba/imba/packages/imba/dist/compiler.mjs:28923:73) at Node2.traverse (file:///Users/abdellah/workspace/scrimba/imba/packages/imba/dist/compiler.mjs:17255:12) at ListNode.visit (file:///Users/abdellah/workspace/scrimba/imba/packages/imba/dist/compiler.mjs:17938:26) at Node2.traverse (file:///Users/abdellah/workspace/scrimba/imba/packages/imba/dist/compiler.mjs:17255:12) at TagLike.visit (file:///Users/abdellah/workspace/scrimba/imba/packages/imba/dist/compiler.mjs:26652:21), ```

comment.body: Hello @haikyuu, `css-selector-parser` was updated to version `3.0.0` which supports what you need. Though some migration is required: https://github.com/mdevils/css-selector-parser/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#migrating-from-2x-to-3x
